content: resyncing just lighthouse-nethermind-1 for now, to see how it fares

content:
sync worked, deploying on all nethermind nodes ðŸ˜„

Jul 28 09:12:01.406 WARN Execution engine call failed            error: ServerMessage { code: -32603, message: "Expected a sequence prefix to be in the range of <192, 255> and got 128 at position 789 in the message of length 858 starting with

author: parithosh
content: <@504202741933932544> does teku not serve `curl localhost:5052/eth/v2/debug/beacon/states/genesis` in some cases? it seems to serve `/eth/v2/debug/beacon/states/finalized` just fine, but `genesis` returns a 404. Lighthouse for e.g is able to handle that call for both finazlied and genesis. Ran into this issue when trying to checkpoint sync a prym node with a teku one.

author: parithosh
content: Yeah teku-nethermind-1 is having issues, its syncing but it got stuck at a certain height with `Nethermind.Serialization.Rlp.RlpException: Expected a sequence prefix to be in the range of \u003C192, 255\u003E and got 128 at position 789 in the message of length 858 starting with`. So really intrigued what this error is and its source... anyone got theories?

author: parithosh
content:
Same for nimbus, so it can never checkpoint sync: `SSZ BeaconState: object dynamic portion starts at invalid offset`. 

Did we change how something works? something about the ssz state? 

and for lodestar <@792822129019584562> , even though I have `--forceCheckpointSync=true`,  I get this: `The downloaded state with epoch 56 is not within weak subjectivity period of 8 from the current epoch 1118`

author: nc1234
content: `--forceCheckpointSync=true` only forces Lodestar to sync via checkpoint instead of other means. It doesn't bypass weak subjectivity (incoming) state validation. Will need to look into it. Is weak subjectivity period being 8 epochs normal?

author: parithosh
content: most clients have a form of `--ignore-weak-subjectivity-period-enabled`, this helps the chain recover if we ever have a massive non-finality event and need some form of manual intervention. I couldn't find a similar flag in lodestar (hence i thought it was the force one, but thanks for the info!) ðŸ˜„

author: nc1234
content: Ohh I see what you mean. We do have it. Try `--ignoreWeakSubjectivityCheck`

author: parithosh
content: that works, lemme see if it gets to head then

author: pk910
content:
the first fork happened at block 1421 (1422 on one side of the fork contained a 7702 tx).
it's really hard to say who forked when afterwards. 
For height 1736, I'm getting 5 blocks from different forks..
